title: US Coast Guard hunts man who went overboard from cruise ship
text:
A desperate search is under way for a 26-year-old man who has jumped from the balcony of his room on board a Carnival Cruise ship around 47 miles off the Texas coast.

The unidentified man was seen leaping overboard from the cruise ship Carnival Dream at 8.45pm on Thursday night.

The US Coast Guard sent a search-and-rescue cutter after midnight, with more than 10 of its crew having joined the initial stages of the search.

The Coast Guard released the cruiseline from the search overnight and the ship continued on its way to Cozumel, Mexico, the company said.

The ship, the Carnival Dream, is a 14-deck vessel that can accommodate more than 3,600 passengers in more than 1,800 cabins. The US Coast Guard said they have launched a search and rescue operation to find a man who is believed to have gone overboard after throwing himself from his balcony

MORE man overboard #CarnivalDream: source on board says the ship will arrive back at the location the man fell from in 25 minutes. Coast Guard on its way - confirms passenger is 26 YO male. Ship left from Galveston. #KHOU11 pics courtesy Charles Griffith pic.twitter.com/tQdlJGtR3q — Lauren Talarico (@KHOULauren) October 25, 2019

A helicopter and a fixed-wing aircraft manned by divers and rescue equipment, including a hoist to lift a person out of the water, are being deployed in the effort.

Passenger Darrell Byer said the search for the missing man is being conducted in rough seas

Footage taken on board shows passengers looking over the edge of the ship into the sea in an attempt to spot the lost man.

According to a statement from Carnival, the man had been on board the ship with family members.

Darrell Byer, a fellow passenger aboard the Carnival Dream, told ABC News that the search was being carried out in 'fairly rough seas.'

Video shot by Byer shows a search spotlight sweeping over the choppy waves in the night.

'They were calling a name out for quite a while, several times, on the intercom,' Byer said. 'And then they said we have a man overboard.'

Carnival Dream started a four-day cruise from Galveston at 3.30pm on Thursday, Carnival Corp said. the vessel's destination was Cozumel.

This map shows the location the US Coast Guard are currently searching, 47 miles from Galveston, Texas

'Based on camera footage, it appears the guest jumped from his stateroom balcony,' it said in a statement.

The 14-deck vessel can accommodate more than 3,600 passengers in more than 1,800 cabins, internet cruise tracking site Ship Technology said.

Two men were reported overboard from Carnival cruises within days of one enough in December 2018.

Luke Renner, 22, a man from Georgia living with autism, was traveling to Mexico on board Carnival Fantasy as part of an organization that works with disabled adults when he climbed over a rail and plunged into the water. His body was never recovered.

'His family believes he may have been under the mistaken assumption that he was going swimming,' a statement from the cruise line said.

Days earlier, 26-year-old Thomas McElhany jumped from the Carnival Victory near the Florida Keys as the ship was returning Miami. After 32-hour search that covered more than 2,000 square miles, the US Coast Guard called off the rescue operation.
description: The US Coast Guard was searching early on Friday for a 26-year-old man who went overboard from a Carnival Cruise ship about 47 miles out in the Gulf of Mexico, near the port of Galveston in Texas.
